message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study utilized data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the Doing Business database to investigate the impact of business environment reforms on firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed household survey data collected by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE) and administrative data from the Ministry of Social Development and Fight against Hunger to estimate the impact of a conditional cash transfer program on educational outcomes.", "dataset": ["household survey data collected by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE)", "administrative data from the Ministry of Social Development and Fight against Hunger"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency and the World Bank, we examined the relationship between energy access and economic growth across developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Energy", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilizes data from the Demographic and Health Survey and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey to examine the determinants of child stunting in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis draws on a combination of survey data from the Informal Manufacturing Survey and firm-level data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys.", "dataset": ["Informal Manufacturing Survey", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the Indian Human Development Survey and the Annual Survey of Industries to explore the relationship between worker skills and wages in India's manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey", "Annual Survey of Industries"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Worldwide Governance Indicators, we investigated the effects of corruption on economic growth in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Worldwide Governance Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Our study utilized satellite imagery from Landsat and socioeconomic data from the WorldPop project to map poverty and analyze its spatial distribution in India.", "dataset": ["Landsat", "WorldPop project"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Spatial Analysis"]}, {"sentence": "We combined household survey data from the National Sample Survey Office with data on weather shocks and crop yields to estimate the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity in India.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Office", "data on weather shocks and crop yields"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This paper used firm-level production data from the Annual Survey of Industries to investigate the effects of export promotion policies on manufacturing productivity in Mexico.", "dataset": ["Annual Survey of Industries"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Trade"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study utilized data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the Doing Business database to investigate the impact of business environment reforms on firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed household survey data collected by the Brazilian educational outcomes.", "dataset": ["household survey data collected by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE)", "administrative data from the Ministry of Social Development and Human Development Survey and the Annual Survey of Industries to explore the relationship between worker skills and wages in India's manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey", "Annual Survey of Industries"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Worldwide Governance Indicators, we {"sentence": "Our study utilized satellite imagery from Landsat and socioeconomic data from the WorldPop project to map poverty and analyze its spatial distribution in India.", "dataset": ["Landsat", estimate the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity in India.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Office", "data on weather shocks and crop yields"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", in Mexico.", "dataset": ["Annual Survey of Industries"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Trade"]}]
